name: Holiday Inn Lafayette - City Centre

reviews.title: Select was excellent
reviews.text: Recently visited Lafayette for a golf weekend and had excellent service and package put together by Holiday Inn Select. We had 16 guys and everyone was very happy and there were no problems whatsoever with rooms, reservations, restaurants, anything. Were back there for sure next year!

We were in town for my step-daughter's wedding. We selected this hotel because there was a bar inside and we would be going there after the wedding. We booked over 20 rooms. My husband spoke with planning coordinator and was told they usually close the bar at 12 a.m., but would stay open later if there were enough customers. At 12:15 we were told it was "last call" by the bartender. We asked to speak with a manager who said he could not help us. We were offered no solution on what to do with our friends and family. They called the police on us for excessive noise when we returned to our room. Since the event we have tried several times to contact the general manager and manager with no response. I think the management of this situation was very poor. No one will return our calls.
reviews.title: very unprofessional management

reviews.text: Hotel overall was above Above-Average but Not Great because when I was on my way to confirm my guaranteed credit card reservation, Front Desk clerk (girl) told me maybe my room would be available on my arrival. Didn't make me feel very comfortable on my hoursss drive. The room was there and available when I arrived. Parking availability was poor on what I believe was a full night. Front Desk personnel could've informed on alternative areas, if any ? Parked in a vacant lot across the street and worried while car was there that it may get towed. Got on the hotels elevators and they were slow, slow, slow. Not because of people, because no on got off or on. In general, the elevators were slow, slow, slow. Everything all around was clean, clean, clean; from the front door, through the lobby, into the rooms. The only items in the room I didn't like is the mold on the shower head, the scummy/smelly inside shower curtain, and the lack of towels for our family in the room. Don't let my comments discourage your stay, because I'd stay there again. Simply, hotel was above above-average but not great ! Pricing was kinda high
reviews.title: Above Above-Average but Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean, houses all the basic amenities (fitness room, pool, restaurant, business center with computers, printers, etc) and the staff were generally polite and helpful. The rooms are not equipped with a safe, a fridge or anything else fancy, but the rooms were clean and decently-sized for the price.
reviews.title: Overall decent stay except for a few exceptions......

reviews.text: However, as some of the other guests pointed out, the walls are paper-thin. On our 2nd morning about 5AM, we both woke up to the sound of an alarm clock going off in the room adjacent to us. It eventually turned itself off after around 10 minutes. The next morning, the same thing happened. Since noone was turning it off, we guessed that the guest had checked out without turning off their alarm. So we called the front desk and asked them if someone would come upstairs and turn it off. Unfortunately, they said they couldn't do that because a guest was still allegedly staying in the room. We were a little frustrated, but we understood. The alarm turned itself off again after 10 minutes. HOWEVER, the phone in the adjacent room now started ringing. Every other minute. We guessed it was the front desk trying to get a hold of the guest to turn his alarm clock off. But by this time the alarm clock was off, and now we had to deal with a phone ringing every other minute for the next half an hour. That did not seem like a very effective way to deal with the problem.
reviews.title: Within Walking Distance to Downtown Lafayette Bars & Restaurants

reviews.text: My parents from overseas were also traveling with us, and since the hotel room is not equipped with a safe, they took their passports and other valuables to the front desk. It took them 10 minutes to locate the form and the key, and once they brought the safe deposit box out and opened it, there were a bunch of official looking forms inside. Apparently she had brought someone else's safe deposit box for my parents to use. She quickly brought out another empty box for them, but by this time they were a little skeptical about storing their valuables with the front desk.
reviews.title: Good value compared with Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn while visiting our son at Purdue. The hotel was OK: reasonably comfortable although without some basic amentiies and with a barebones bathroom. It is reasonaly close to Purdue by car, and within easy walking distance of Lafyette's restaurants and stores. This was easily the most expensive Holiday Inn I have stayed at, probably because it was Family Day at Purdue and a home football game. Unfortunately there are not many alternatives unless you want to stay out by the interstate.
reviews.title: OK Choice for Visiting Purude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night while in town for a wedding. The entryway is very nice, open, and gives off a feel you are in a nice hotel. The staff was courteous as we wanted to check in early, no problems. Basic room. We did hear some loud guests around 2am running down the hall. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, fine location

reviews.text: would strongly recommend this hotel if you want to be in downtown Lafayette. Purdue is about nine blocks away (hilton Garden Inn is closer). Great and friendly staff, nice rooms, ample parking.
reviews.title: nice hotel friendly staff

reviews.text: We booked this hotel back in March for a "football weekend" in November. We had to cancel the reservation about a week later due to a wedding that we found out was the same weekend. Called the hotel directly and canceled our reservation. On my credit card bill in October, I got charged for the entire weekend's stay. I called to hotel to inquire and they said that they didn't have a record of our cancellation and I needed a cancellation number (which I no longer had since it was 8 months later... who saves a cancellation number for 8 months? I hadn't thought about this reservation since we canceled it in April). Talked to the reservation specialist and hotel manager who refused to do anything but keep out deposit (over $500 for two nights which is a little outrageous anyway) even though it was their mistake. The hotel refused to give us a refund so we are now disputing the charges with our credit card company. I am so ticked about this... never had a problem with anything like this and we travel a lot! BEWARE!!
reviews.title: Beware of cancelling... we still got charged!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the night at the City Centre on a non-football game Saturday, and got a great rate on the room. Upon check-in, we were greeted by two very friendly staff members and I was upgraded rooms because I had joined the "Priority Club" (no charge) at the time I made the reservation.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: I was very surprised to read the poor reviews for this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at the last minute, after deciding to stay in town after a wedding. While we didn't end up on the same floor as the other wedding guests, our room was still great.
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.text: It was very clean, spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. Other reviews complained about being able to hear noise from other rooms, but we did not experience that. And we know that there were people in the room beside us. The furniture was not brand new, but was definitely not outdated. I'm sure it would have been nice to have had a flat screen tv, but we never even turned the tv on.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay in Lafayette

reviews.text: I'm used to staying in Holiday Inns that offer free continental breakfast. That is not the case for this hotel, although the restaurant in the lobby offers both a buffet breakfast as well as ordering from a menu.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a bit pricey, but there was nothing wrong with the property itself.
reviews.title: pass on this one

reviews.text: Other than those two little hitches, our stay was very comfortable and we would consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Staffs...except for one thing (beware)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friends & I stayed at this hotel because it is within walking distance to the popular downtown Lafayette restaurants, bars, and theaters and it is about a 5 minute drive to the Purdue University campus. The Lafayette/West Lafayette free shuttle has a stop right out front which was convenient. We had a corner room which was huge and very clean. The hotel was a bit expensive but that may have been due to homecoming weekend. The hotel bar closed at midnight which was disappointing, but there were many other places in town to go for a nightcap.
reviews.title: the service is not as good as the exterior

likes.disliked: — the service and the decor of the room

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. As a priority member i didn't get a better room. At reservation, I was told hotel shuttle will offer service to the local area. However, after i checked in i was told shuttle was not running during the morning.
reviews.title: Beautiful Review
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The exterior hotel looks the Best in the neighborhood, location is central in town center of Lafayette. Our room is near the pool where we can share the chlorine aroma from the pool.

reviews.title: Top Notch Hotel
reviews.text: The room is spacious with wireless in the public area. The deco looks dated.

The location was nice, but are stay was prompted by a severe weather storm. We paid around $150 each night of our stay. The rooms were clean but had an outdated tv. They also charged $10 night for the use of a frig...this room should of had the appliances already...small pool, and the next day, the prices were lowered to $91 for the same room! Very shady for an "upscale" hotel. I will stay at the Hilton across the street next time!!! Expectations were not met...
reviews.title: Price gauged before winter storm!!!

aka: Holiday Inn Lafayette - City Centre Hotel Lafayette
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Lafayette City Centre in Lafayette, Indiana Returning the tradition and elegance to historic downtown Lafayette, Indiana, the Holiday Inn Lafayette City Centre offers 147 hotel rooms and 7,500 square feet of meeting space. A grand, new hotel built to reflect the quality and craftsmanship of a bygone era, Holiday Inn Lafayette City Centre rises 8 stories above ground, establishing a new landmark in the downtown skyline. From our rooms, guests can look out over scenic downtown Lafayette. Located in the business district, this grand hotel is blocks from the Tippecanoe County Court House, walking distance to the Long Center, theaters, art galleries, restaurants, live entertainment and more. We are also just one mile from Purdue University in West Lafayette, and close to many major businesses such as Eli Lilly, Wabash National, Caterpillar, TRW, Alcoa, Arnett Clinic, Landis & Gyr, Chemtura, Toyota, Subaru, Wal-Mart, Cargill, Fairfield, State Farm Insurance, St. Elizabeth Hospital, Home Hospital, and Unity Medical Center. Ascend our grand staircase in the main two-story lobby to the elegant meeting rooms on the second floor. Experience Italian dining at Toscana Italian Grill & Bar, where the menu includes seasonal and fresh market ingredients including premium ground beef, ground fresh from whole cuts of beef. Toscana also offers its customers a fine selection.
